question: <katex>$f:R\rightarrow R$</katex> and <katex>$g:[0,\infty)\rightarrow R$</katex> are defined by <katex>$f(x)=x^{2}$</katex> and <katex>$g(x)=\sqrt{x}$</katex>. Which one of the following is not true?
explanation: (D) <katex>$(fog)(-4)$</katex>: <katex>$g(-4)$</katex> is undefined (domain of g is <katex>$[0, \infty)$</katex>). So <katex>fog</katex> is not defined at -4. Even if calculating formally <katex>g(-4)=\sqrt{-4}</katex> (imaginary), not in R. The expression says <katex>=4</katex>, which implies validity.
Wait, <katex>fog(-4)</katex> is undefined. So statement D is NOT true.
